item.description:
Don't let winter slow down your hiking, Join us for a winter hike of Mts. Tom, Field & Willey!

We begin our day at the Avalon Trailhead located at the Crawford Depot just south of the AMC Highland Center. We ascend Mt. Tom via the Avalon, A-Z & Mt. Tom spur trails. From the summit of Tom we follow the Willey Range trail over the summits of Mt. Field & Willey.

Should the snowpack be deep we will retrace our steps back to our cars located near the Highland Center. If the snowpack is not very deep we may descend via the Willey Range & Kedron Flume trails to a spotted car. This decision will be made on the morning of this hike.

Please add your name to the waiting list and I will contact you for more information regarding your winter hiking experience.



***** IMPORTANT NOTES *****

This event is categorized as advanced and is not for beginners.

Any changes or cancellations will be expressed to hikers that have RSVP'd "YES" for this event.

Please arrive early and be prepared to start at the designated time.



Mountain weather is subject to rapid changes and extreme conditions. We will assess travel and weather conditions during our hike and make changes to our planned trip as necessary.

Being prepared, traveling with the appropriate gear & knowing how to use it is your personal responsibility. Test and adjust your gear prior to this trip.

!! NO COTTON CLOTHING !! - Cotton (a.k.a. the death cloth) has no place in the mountains. If you arrive wearing cotton clothing you will be turned away.



As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
